item.title: AJ add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat." -- Rebecca West

item.title: AJ add a quote by Cheris Kramarae
item.description: "Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings." -- Cheris Kramarae

item.title: AJ add a quote by Roseanne Barr
item.description: "The thing women have yet to learn is nobody gives you power. You just take it. " -- Roseanne Barr

item.title: AJ add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: AJ add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Everybody is identical in their secret unspoken belief that way deep down they are different from everyone else." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: AJ add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: AJ add a quote by Bill Nye
item.description: "Everyone you will ever meet knows something you don't." -- Bill Nye

item.title: AJ add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: AJ add a quote by Patricia Highsmith
item.description: "Anticipation! It occurred to him that his anticipation was more pleasant to him than the experiencing." -- Patricia Highsmith

item.title: AJ add a quote by Keri Hulme
item.description: "You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read..." -- Keri Hulme

item.title: AJ add a quote by Cesare Pavese
item.description: "Leggendo non cerchiamo idee nuove, ma pensieri già da noi pensati, che acquistano sulla pagina un suggello di conferma." -- Cesare Pavese

item.title: AJ add a quote by Cesare Pavese
item.description: "Meanwhile we arrived at our lane and the sight of the olive tree rubbed me the wrong way. I began to see that no spot is less habitable than a place where one has been happy." -- Cesare Pavese

item.title: AJ add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help." -- Bill Watterson
